clause: Refunds Travel plans can change at a moment's notice.

clause: If you're no longer traveling and need to cancel a reservation, your options and refund eligibility will depend on your ticket type.
label: refunds

clause: What if I have not received my travel credit refund?
label: refunds

clause: If you cannot find your credit under your name, and you are traveling with others, check the reservation of the primary traveler in the original reservation.
label: none

clause: Also, sign out of your JetBlue travel credit account and then sign in.
label: none

clause: If you still have not received the expected refund, contact us for additional assistance.
label: refunds

clause: Be aware that some fees, such as tourism taxes, are nonrefundable in most cases.
label: refunds

clause: All travel credits are subject to their original expiration date.
label: none

clause: If you booked using travel credit and cancel the ticket, any credit that has already expired will not be returned to your JetBlue travel credit account.
label: none

clause: Learn more about JetBlue travel credits.
label: none

clause: Refundable fare policy Refundable fare policy For JetBlue refundable fares, cancellations are permitted any time prior to the scheduled departure for a full refund to the original form of payment.
label: refunds

clause: Refundable fares may not be available on all flights.
label: refunds

clause: If an eligible refundable reservation is not changed or cancelled prior to the scheduled departure, all money associated with the reservation will be in the form of a JetBlue travel credit, valid for 12 months from original ticketing date, and may be applied toward future travel.
label: refunds

clause: Partially used reservation If you wish to cancel any remaining travel after a portion of your refundable trip has been taken, your refund amount will equal the one-way fare for the portion of the trip cancelled.
label: refunds

clause: This also applies if a portion of your travel is not operated as scheduled by JetBlue.
label: none

clause: No show or missed flight Refundable fares must be changed or cancelled prior to the scheduled departure time in order to receive a refund to the original form of payment.
label: refunds

clause: If a flight is missed, the money associated with the reservation will be in the form of a JetBlue travel credit, valid for 12 months from original ticketing date, and may be applied toward future travel.
label: none

clause: See JetBlue travel credit info Nonrefundable fare policy Nonrefundable fare policy For JetBlue nonrefundable fares, cancellations can be made prior to the scheduled departure.
label: refunds

clause: A per person cancellation fee may apply depending on the fare option selected.
label: refunds

clause: Any remaining balance will be in the form of a JetBlue travel credit, valid for 12 months from original ticketing date.
label: none

clause: No show or missed flight If an eligible nonrefundable reservation is not changed or cancelled prior to scheduled departure, all money associated with the reservation will be forfeited.
label: refunds

clause: This includes extra ancillary purchases such as EvenMore® seat selection, priority security, additional checked bag fees, etc.
label: none

clause: See JetBlue travel credit info Canceling within 24 hours Cancellations within 24 hours If your travel was booked seven days or more prior to the scheduled departure date, you have 24 hours from the time the booking was made to cancel your reservation without being charged a cancellation fee.
label: refunds

clause: The entire booking must be cancelled to qualify (not applicable for JetBlue Vacations reservations).
label: none

clause: Change or cancel your flight Flight changes made by JetBlue If your flight is changed or cancelled by JetBlue, visit our Delays, Cancellations, and Schedule Changes page for more details about your options and refund eligibility.
label: refunds

clause: Frequently asked questions Fare change questions I changed my flight, and my fare is less.
label: none

clause: The refunded amount will automatically be issued to your JetBlue travel credit account as a JetBlue travel credit.
label: refunds

clause: If you have a Blue Basic fare, change fees will apply before the refund is issued.

clause: The refund will not be returned to your original form of payment.

clause: Can I refund my current ticket to get a lower fare?
label: refunds

clause: You can cancel and rebook your fare at the current rate on the website.
label: none

clause: If you have a Blue Basic ticket, all fees apply.
label: none

clause: If during your rebooking process the price of the fare increases, we cannot reinstate your previous fare.
label: none

clause: You will need to purchase the fare at the current price that is shown.
label: none

clause: All fares are subject to change until purchase.
label: none

clause: You can also visit our Best Fare Guarantee page to learn more about our current program.
label: none

clause: Airport issues How do I get compensated for a trip that did not go as planned?
label: none

clause: Please review our Customer Service Plan and Our Promises for more information on how we want to make things right, when things go wrong.
label: none

clause: JetBlue does not provide compensation for uncontrollable events.
label: none

clause: For travel booked directly through JetBlue: If your flight qualifies for compensation, you will receive an email from JetBlue within seven days of your flight's scheduled departure.
label: none

clause: This will happen automatically and there is no need to contact JetBlue.
label: none

clause: Heads up: Beginning in early 2026, Customer Bill of Rights compensation will be issued as TrueBlue points instead of a JetBlue travel credit.
label: none

clause: To receive points, customers must have a TrueBlue account attached to their reservation prior to departure.
label: none

clause: For travel not booked directly through JetBlue: We may not have your contact information, so if your flight qualifies for compensation, please contact us seven days or more after your flight's scheduled departure to inquire about potential compensation.
label: none

clause: I did not bring correct travel documents.
label: none

clause: The ticket will be subject to regular fare rules for refunds.
label: refunds

clause: JetBlue does not refund the original form of payment if you missed the flight due to incorrect or expired travel documents.

clause: Please note: It is the Customer’s responsibility to check for specific document requirements for the country you are visiting.

clause: See the handy online documentation lookup tool on jetblue.com.

clause: My flight was delayed, but then it left earlier.
label: none

clause: JetBlue does not issue refunds for missing delayed flights.
label: refunds

clause: For delays, we suggest you arrive at the airport for the originally scheduled departure time, since departure times can continue to change.
label: none

clause: If the delay is shorter than predicted, the flight may leave on time.
label: none

clause: See the Delays, Cancellations and Schedule Changes page for more details.
label: none

clause: Review your free checked bag guidelines to be sure you qualify.

clause: It does take extra time to go through the free checked bag process.

clause: Be sure to allow extra time to check bags and go through security.

clause: Please review the Airport Information page to check recommended arrival times.

clause: Can I move my JetBlue travel credit refund to my credit card?
label: refunds

clause: Once you choose to have your refund go into your travel credit account as a JetBlue travel credit, it cannot be refunded back to your original form of payment.
label: refunds

clause: Can I get a refund for a flight I cancelled less than 24 hours ago?
label: refunds

clause: To receive a refund for cancelling a booking within 24 hours: The reservation must have been booked less than 24 hours before the cancellation time.
label: refunds

clause: All travel dates must be 7 or more days in the future.
label: none

clause: You will not receive a refund to your credit card if: You cancel only a portion of your trip.
label: refunds

clause: One or more of your trip dates are within 7 days of booking.
label: none

clause: Travel must be scheduled for 7 or more days in advance.
label: none

clause: Contact us to assist you with transferring the flight onto your new card.

clause: There are no change or cancellation fees (except for Blue Basic fares).

clause: Pet carriers are nonrefundable once the packaging is open.
